title: How to Make a Picture Link in HTML

steps.title: Open a text editing program such as Notepad or WordPad on Windows, or, on a Mac open up TextEdit, or Dreamweaver on either platform.
steps.content: Open a text editing program such as Notepad or WordPad on Windows, or, on a Mac open up TextEdit, or Dreamweaver on either platform. You can also use Notepad++ , if you want.

steps.title: Type all preceding HTML text that you want before the photo-based link.
steps.content: Type all preceding HTML text that you want before the photo-based link.

steps.title: Type the photo-based link opening tag (known by it's more sophisticated name as an "anchor" element-hence the "a"), <a href=".
steps.content: Type the photo-based link opening tag (known by it's more sophisticated name as an " a nchor" element-hence the "a"), <a href=".
Type the link you want the viewer to see (including the http://)

steps.title: Follow the that portion of the text off with another quotation mark (") and triangular bracket (>).
steps.content: Follow the that portion of the text off with another quotation mark (") and triangular bracket (>).

steps.title: Type the image, in HTML form, of the picture you'd like to use.
steps.content: Type the image, in HTML form, of the picture you'd like to use. Use the form .

steps.title: Close the photo-based link with a link-closing HTML tag.
steps.content: Close the photo-based link with a link-closing HTML tag. Type the photo-based link closing tag, .

steps.title: Type the proceeding HTML text that you want for the remainder of the document.
steps.content: Type the proceeding HTML text that you want for the remainder of the document.
